paper.title: Can D.S.A. be improved? — Complexity trade-offs with the digital signature standard —
paper.venue: Theory and Application of Cryptographic Techniques
paper.abstract: The Digital Signature Algorithm (DSA) was proposed in 1991 by the US National Institute of Standards and Technology to provide an appropriate core for applications requiring digital signatures. Undoubtedly, many applications will include this standard in the future and thus, the foreseen domination of DSA as a legal certification tool is sufficiently important to focus research endeavours on the suitability of this scheme to various situations.
